title: Publicly accessible Order confirmations leaking User Emails on ███
content:
Summary:
I noticed that a user's order confirmation was publicly accessible leaking email information
Description:
An attacker can gleam sensitive information that is stored in the order confirmation file
## Impact
Medium
## Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
https://██████████/BinaryHandler.ashx?RecordID=MZtO1v39KiFWXykCvQEcOw%3D%3D
Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
N/A
## Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Scrub user data
Impact
Attackers can steal PII
steps: Navigate to the publicly accessible order confirmation URL: https://██████████/BinaryHandler.ashx?RecordID=MZtO1v39KiFWXykCvQEcOw%3D%3D
Observe the exposed user email in the order confirmation details
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves publicly accessible order confirmations that leak user email information, which is a form of Personally Identifiable Information (PII). This allows attackers to gather sensitive data without authentication.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves accessing a direct URL that is not properly secured. There are no complex interactions or state manipulations required, and the issue is a common oversight in web applications.
